marketNews.title: Base Metals Increasingly Hot, Nickel Returns Above US$21,000/Ton
marketNews.content: A number of base metal commodities experienced a rally in price increases over the last week. Based on the London Metal Exchange (LME) reference prices for 3-month futures contracts, nickel prices jumped +11.2% WoW to a level of 21,080 US dollars per ton, followed by copper which rose +6.6% WoW to a level of 10,668 US dollars per ton, and a strengthening tin price of +6.7% WoW to a level of 34,251 US dollars per ton. There are a number of factors that support this commodity price rally, including: - Easing US inflation - US inflation data for April 2024 reported a decline to the 3.4% YoY level (vs. Mar 2024: 3.5% YoY), in line with consensus expectations. This result ended the previous 3-month trend that consecutively exceeded consensus expectations, thus reviving the possibility of the Fed starting interest rate cuts in 2024. This has the potential to increase economic activity, which can increase industrial demand for base metal commodities. - China government stimulus - On May 17, 2024, the Chinese government began issuing bonds worth 1 trillion yuan (138 billion US dollars), aimed as stimulus to boost key economic sectors in the country. This stimulus has the potential to increase economic activity in China, thus becoming a positive sentiment for global commodity price movements. - Supply disruption concerns - The wave of riots in New Caledonia, which is the world's third-largest nickel-producing country. The riots raised concerns about disruptions to the world's nickel supply. - Delayed production permits from Indonesian mining - The approval process for mineral mining RKAB (Work Plan and Budget for Mineral and Coal Mining) is still running slow in Indonesia. The government is reported not to have provided an update on the status of nickel RKAB approvals in the last 2 months. As of the end of March 2024, only 15 tin mining RKABs have been approved. This is feared to cause operational production disruptions. Indonesia is an important player in global base metal production. Based on U.S. Geological Survey estimates in 2023, Indonesia contributes to 50% of global nickel production, 18% of global tin production, and 4% of global copper production. Key Takeaway: The rise in base metal commodity prices has the potential to increase the Average Selling Price (ASP), which can lead to margin increases for the producing issuers. Along with this commodity rally, issuers that proxy these commodities experienced price appreciation in the last week: - Nickel: $MBMA (+15.18%), $INCO (+14.19%), $ANTM (+8.88%), $NCKL (+6.19%) - Copper: $AMMN (+6.6%), $MDKA (+2.53%) - Tin: $TINS (+4.3%)

tickerNews.title: ACES: SSSG +6.8% YoY in April 2024
tickerNews.content: $ACES: Ace Hardware Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +6.8% YoY in April 2024 (vs. Mar 2024: +19.9% YoY, Apr 2023: +15% YoY), with an indicative sales value of 763 billion rupiah. This result remains above expectations, considering the effect of seasonality changes and the high base effect due to Ramadan 2023 falling entirely in April, while Ramadan 2024 fell in March and April. SSSG in April 2024 occurred across all regions, namely Jakarta (+4.1%), Java outside Jakarta (+6.9%), and outside Java (+8.2%). For 4M24, ACES recorded SSSG of +11.4% YoY, with an indicative sales value of 2.7 trillion rupiah. ACES management targets SSSG during 2024 to grow by +7% YoY.

tickerNews.title: ADRO: Plans base capital reduction by repurchasing treasury shares
tickerNews.content: $ADRO: Adaro Energy Indonesia plans to reduce its base capital by repurchasing approximately 1.23 billion treasury shares, equivalent to 3.84% of issued and paid-up capital. This corporate action is aimed at enhancing shareholder value and creating a more efficient capital structure. After this corporate action, the issued and fully paid-up capital in ADRO will decrease from approximately 3.2 trillion rupiah to approximately 3.08 billion rupiah. This plan was approved at the GMS on May 15, 2024.

tickerNews.title: PSSI: To distribute 2023 dividends of IDR 48 per share
tickerNews.content: $PSSI: IMC Pelita Logistik will distribute 2023 book year dividends amounting to 251.1 billion rupiah or 48 rupiah per share. The cum dividend and payment dates have not been announced. Referring to the PSSI share price on Monday (20/5) at 478 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 10%.

tickerNews.title: IMPC Approves Private Placement of shares up to 10%
tickerNews.content: $IMPC: Impack Pratama Industri shareholders approved a private placement plan of up to approximately 5.4 billion (10%) shares with a maximum dilution effect of 8.03%. Corporate Finance Manager of IMPC, Nixon Randy Wisata, stated that the execution price assumption ranges around 346 rupiah per share or equivalent to approximately 1.9 trillion rupiah. The funds are intended for capital expenditure, business development including acquisition opportunities, working capital, and long-term loan repayment. Nevertheless, Nixon stated that they are still seeking strategic investors in this corporate action.

tickerNews.title: SMGR: Cement sales volume declined in April 2024
tickerNews.content: $SMGR: Semen Indonesia recorded cement sales volume of 2 million tons (-37% MoM, -8.9% YoY) in April 2024. Sales volume from facilities in Indonesia dropped to 1.8 million tons (-38% MoM, -8.5% YoY), while sales from facilities in Vietnam dropped to 131 thousand tons (-17.6% MoM, -15.2% YoY). Cumulatively during 4M24, sales volume decreased by -3.4% YoY to approximately 11.1 million tons.

tickerNews.title: Indonesian ceramic industry pays gas price exceeding HGBT policy due to PGAS supply constraints
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that 7 industrial sectors receiving the Specific Gas Price (HGBT) policy of 6 US dollars per mmbtu must pay gas prices exceeding the provisions due to a significant drop in supply from Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS). The General Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association, Edy Suyanto, told Kontan that the national ceramic industry must pay an average gas price of 9.44-10 US dollars per mmbtu due to limited supply from PGAS. Meanwhile, the General Chairman of the Gas Users Industry Forum, Yustinus Gunawan, stated that setting the quota for cheap gas from PGAS risks encouraging de-industrialization.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Controller Increased Stake via Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: The controller of AKR Corporindo ($AKRA), PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased approximately 24.7 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,619 rupiah per share on May 8-16, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 40.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Arthakencana Rayatama in AKRA increased from 61.08% to 61.20%.

tickerNews.title: BSDE, Astra Land Indonesia, and Hongkong Land Form Joint Venture for Navapark Residential Project
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Bumi Serpong Damai ($BSDE), Astra Land Indonesia, and Hongkong Land have formed a joint venture on April 30, 2024, to build Navapark, a high-end residential project spanning approximately 80 hectares in BSD City. Previously, BSDE and Astra Land Indonesia also cooperated in 2023 to build a township project of approximately 70 hectares in Cibubur.

tickerNews.title: TLKM Collaborates with Starlink (SpaceX) for Business Services
tickerNews.content: Telkom Indonesia ($TLKM) through its subsidiary, PT Telkom Satelit Indonesia (Telkomsat), signed a cooperation agreement with Starlink, SpaceX's satellite-based internet network. In this collaboration, Telkomsat will deploy Starlink-based business services. Previously, Telkomsat and Starlink have cooperated since 2021 regarding backhaul services and the provision of satellite landing rights.

tickerNews.title: Indonesian Minister Claims Elon Musk Considers Building EV Battery Plant in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, claimed that Tesla and SpaceX CEO, Elon Musk, is considering an offer to build an electric vehicle battery plant in Indonesia. Elon Musk has not yet responded to Luhut's claim. Previously, Elon Musk attended the launch of Starlink for the health sector and the World Water Forum in Bali on Sunday (19/5).
